document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of Willowsia (Collembola: Entomobryidae) from Guizhou Province, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of Willowsia (Collembola: Entomobryidae) from Guizhou Province, China

subSubSection.paragraph: A longitudinal stripe present from eyepatch to Th. III along lateral side; Abd. I with 3 mac; Abd. II with 3 central mac; Abd. III with 2 central and 3 lateral mac; scales spinulate type and present on Ant. I̅II, dorsal side of head and terga, coxa to tibiotarsus, anterior face of ventral tube and ventral side of manubrium.
Named after the characteristic six (Latin word “ sex- ”) macrochaetae present on the central part of Abd. IV.

materialsCitation.collectedFrom: in rotten stem of maize and litter

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype
CHINA : ♀ , on slide, Louna Village , Dingxiao Town , Xingyi City , Guizhou Province , 25°09′33″ N , 105°02′35″ E ,
1300 m a.s.l.
, in rotten stem of maize and litter ,
21 Apr. 2014
, Shangze Wu leg. (collection number 1132, NTU ).

caption.paragraph:
Table 2. Comparison of
W. sexachaeta
sp. nov. ,
W. baoshanensis Chai & Ma, 2017
and
W. japonica Folsom 1898
.

tr.th: Scales on antennae, legs and manubrium
Mac a2 & a3 on Th. III

paragraph.materialsCitation: CHINA : 9 ♀♀ , on slides, same data as holotype.

subSubSection.paragraph: MEASURMENTS. Body length up to 1.6 mm .

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 1.
Willowsia sexachaeta
sp. nov. A −B. Habitus. Scale bars: 500 μm.

Fig. 2.
Willowsia sexachaeta
sp. nov. A . Apex of Ant. IV. B. Dorsal chaetotaxy of head. C . Labrum. D . Lateral process of labial palp. E . Labium. F . Chaetotaxy of Th. II̅III. G . Trochanteral organ. H . Foot complex. Scale bars: A, C̅E, G–H = 20 μm; B, F = 100 μm.

Fig. 3.
Willowsia sexachaeta
sp. nov. A . Chaetotaxy of Abd. I̅III. B. Chaetotaxy of Abd. IV. C . Anterior face of ventral tube. D . Posterior face of ventral tube. E . Lateral flap of ventral tube. F . Manubrial plaque. G . Distal part of dens and mucro. Scale bars: A–B = 100 μm; C̅G = 20 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph: not reaching apex of labial papilla ( Fig. 2D ). Labial triangular chaetae as MREL 1L2, all finely ciliate ( Fig. 2E ).
SCALES. Hyaline, spinulate type , leaf-like and present on Ant. I̅II, dorsal side of head and terga, coxa to tibiotarsus, anterior face of ventral tube and ventral side of manubrium ( Figs 4B–4C ).

The new species is similar to another Chinese species,
W. baoshanensis Chai & Ma, 2017
, in colour pattern and scale morphology, but the difference between them in chaetotaxy is great. It is also similar to the species
W. japonica ( Folsom, 1897 )
in colour pattern on the body and three mac on Abd. I, but scale morphology is of the spinulate type in the former and the short rib type in the latter ( Table 1 ). The differences between the three species are great, as shown in Table 2 .
